item.title: NEW: CodeRED Emergency Alert System Crippled by 'Inc Ransom' Attack, Disrupting US Public Safety
item.description:
Headline: CodeRED Emergency Alert System Crippled by 'Inc Ransom' Attack, Disrupting US Public Safety

Summary:
The OnSolve CodeRED emergency alert system, a critical communication tool for hundreds of U.S. municipalities, has been taken offline following a ransomware attack claimed by the 'Inc Ransom' group. The attack, which began on November 1, 2025, resulted in the encryption of systems and the exfiltration of user data, including names, addresses, and contact information. After failed ransom negotiations, the vendor was forced to decommission the legacy platform, causing significant service disruptions for local governments in numerous states and leaving them unable to issue vital public safety notifications.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Cyberattack, Data Breach

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: CodeRED ransomware attack, Inc Ransom, OnSolve data breach, emergency alert system hack, US public safety cyberattack, Crisis24, ransomware negotiation, critical infrastructure security

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A ransomware attack by the 'Inc Ransom' group has disabled the OnSolve CodeRED emergency alert system, impacting public safety notifications across the United States and resulting in a user data breach.

Article Slug: us-emergency-alert-system-codered-crippled-by-inc-ransom-attack

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Major Wall Street Banks Exposed in SitusAMC Supply Chain Data Breach
item.description:
Headline: Major Wall Street Banks Exposed in SitusAMC Supply Chain Data Breach

Summary:
SitusAMC, a key technology vendor for the real-estate finance industry, has suffered a significant data breach, exposing sensitive data belonging to some of America's largest banks. The attack, which occurred on November 12, 2025, compromised corporate data such as accounting records and legal agreements. Breach notifications have reportedly been sent to major financial institutions including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, and Morgan Stanley. The incident was a data theft attack, with no ransomware deployed, highlighting the severe supply-chain risks facing the financial sector. An investigation is underway to determine the full extent of the breach, which may also include customer data from the affected banks.

Severity: High

Categories: Data Breach, Supply Chain Attack, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: SitusAMC data breach, supply chain attack finance, JPMorgan Chase breach, Citi data breach, Morgan Stanley security, Wall Street cyber attack, financial services breach, third-party risk

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Financial technology vendor SitusAMC suffered a major data breach, impacting top Wall Street banks like JPMorgan Chase, Citi, and Morgan Stanley through a supply chain attack.

Article Slug: situsamc-supply-chain-breach-exposes-major-us-banks

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Warns: Spyware Actively Hijacking Signal and WhatsApp Accounts of High-Value Targets
item.description:
Headline: CISA Warns: Spyware Actively Hijacking Signal and WhatsApp Accounts of High-Value Targets

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued an alert about active campaigns targeting high-value individuals through the Signal and WhatsApp messaging apps. Threat actors, including state-aligned groups, are using commercial spyware and Remote Access Trojans (RATs) to gain full access to victims' devices and communications. Attack vectors include sophisticated phishing, malicious QR codes for device linking, spoofed application downloads, and even zero-click exploits. The targets primarily consist of government officials, military personnel, and civil society organizations in the U.S., Europe, and the Middle East, prompting CISA to urge heightened mobile security awareness.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Threat Intelligence, Mobile Security

Article Type: Advisory

Keywords: CISA spyware warning, Signal security, WhatsApp hack, zero-click exploit, mobile spyware, LANDFALL malware, high-value targets, encrypted messaging

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: CISA warns that threat actors are actively using spyware, RATs, and zero-click exploits to compromise the Signal and WhatsApp accounts of government officials and other high-value targets.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-of-spyware-targeting-signal-and-whatsapp-users

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Geopolitical Shift: Russian and North Korean State Hackers Found Sharing Attack Infrastructure
item.description:
Headline: Geopolitical Shift: Russian and North Korean State Hackers Found Sharing Attack Infrastructure

Summary:
In a rare and alarming discovery, security researchers have found evidence of operational collaboration between two of the world's most prolific state-sponsored hacking groups: Russia's Gamaredon (Pitty Tiger) and North Korea's Lazarus. The evidence centers on a shared command-and-control (C2) server IP address that was used by both groups within days of each other to deliver their respective malware payloads. This convergence of TTPs and infrastructure signals a potential new phase of cyber operations where geopolitical alliances between Moscow and Pyongyang are extending into direct, cooperative attacks, potentially amplifying the threat level for defenders globally.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Threat Intelligence, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Gamaredon Lazarus collaboration, Russian North Korean hackers, APT collaboration, shared C2 infrastructure, InvisibleFerret malware, Pitty Tiger, state-sponsored hacking, geopolitical cyber threats

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: Security researchers have uncovered a rare collaboration between Russian state-sponsored hackers Gamaredon and North Korea's Lazarus group, who were observed using shared command-and-control infrastructure.

Article Slug: unprecedented-collaboration-found-between-russian-gamaredon-and-north-korean-lazarus-apts

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Water Gamayun APT Exploits Novel 'MSC EvilTwin' Windows Flaw in Stealthy Attacks
item.description:
Headline: Water Gamayun APT Exploits Novel 'MSC EvilTwin' Windows Flaw in Stealthy Attacks

Summary:
The Russia-aligned APT group Water Gamayun is actively exploiting a novel vulnerability in the Windows Microsoft Management Console (MMC), tracked as CVE-2025-26633. The attack, analyzed by Zscaler and dubbed 'MSC EvilTwin,' uses a malicious .msc file to proxy code execution through the trusted mmc.exe binary, making it difficult to detect. The multi-stage campaign begins with a malicious download and uses embedded commands to execute hidden PowerShell payloads. This technique allows the attackers to install backdoors and information stealers while evading traditional security measures, showcasing the group's continued sophistication in developing stealthy intrusion methods.

Severity: High

Categories: Threat Actor, Vulnerability, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Water Gamayun, CVE-2025-26633, MSC EvilTwin, mmc.exe exploit, signed binary proxy execution, PowerShell attack, Zscaler threat hunting, Russia APT

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: The Russia-aligned APT group Water Gamayun is exploiting a new Windows Microsoft Management Console vulnerability, CVE-2025-26633, to deliver stealthy PowerShell payloads.

Article Slug: water-gamayun-apt-exploits-windows-msc-eviltwin-vulnerability

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: Shai-Hulud 2.0: Destructive NPM Worm Compromises 25K+ GitHub Repos, Wipes Dev Systems
item.description:
Headline: Shai-Hulud 2.0: Destructive NPM Worm Compromises 25K+ GitHub Repos, Wipes Dev Systems

Summary:
A second, more aggressive wave of the 'Shai-Hulud' supply chain attack is devastating the npm ecosystem. Dubbed 'Shai-Hulud 2.0,' this variant has already compromised hundreds of npm packages, including those from major organizations like Zapier and Postman, and led to the creation of over 25,000 malicious GitHub repositories containing stolen developer secrets. The new version executes during the 'preinstall' phase, bypassing some scanners, and introduces a dangerous destructive capability: if it fails to exfiltrate stolen credentials, it attempts to wipe the user's entire home directory, escalating the threat from espionage to outright sabotage.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Cloud Security

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: Shai-Hulud 2.0, npm supply chain attack, GitHub secrets leak, preinstall script exploit, destructive malware, Zapier compromised, Postman compromised, Wiz research

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A new, more aggressive 'Shai-Hulud 2.0' npm supply chain attack is compromising thousands of GitHub repositories and includes a destructive payload to wipe developer systems.

Article Slug: shai-hulud-2-npm-attack-intensifies-with-destructive-capabilities

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Industrial Control Systems, Including CVSS 10.0 Bug
item.description:
Headline: CISA Warns of Critical Flaws in Industrial Control Systems, Including CVSS 10.0 Bug

Summary:
On November 25, 2025, CISA issued seven new advisories for vulnerabilities in Industrial Control Systems (ICS) from multiple vendors, including Rockwell Automation, Opto 22, and Zenitel. The flaws affect equipment used globally in critical manufacturing and communications sectors. The most severe vulnerability, CVE-2025-64130, is a critical OS command injection flaw in Zenitel communications equipment with a CVSS score of 10.0, which could allow for remote code execution. Other advisories cover flaws leading to denial-of-service and information exposure, prompting CISA to urge immediate review and mitigation by asset owners.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Keywords: CISA ICS advisories, CVE-2025-64130, Zenitel vulnerability, Rockwell Automation security, Opto 22 groov View, industrial control systems, OT security, critical manufacturing

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: CISA has issued seven new advisories for critical vulnerabilities in industrial control systems (ICS), including a CVSS 10.0 flaw (CVE-2025-64130) in Zenitel products.

Article Slug: cisa-issues-seven-advisories-for-critical-ics-vulnerabilities

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: US Cyber Strategy Shifts to APTs as CISA Faces 17% Budget Cut, Staffing Crisis
item.description:
Headline: US Cyber Strategy Shifts to APTs as CISA Faces 17% Budget Cut, Staffing Crisis

Summary:
The U.S. federal cybersecurity strategy is undergoing a major recalibration, shifting its focus toward high-end threats from state actors and APTs. However, this strategic pivot is overshadowed by a draft 2026 budget that proposes a severe 17% cut for CISA, amounting to nearly $495 million and the elimination of over 1,000 positions. This reduction threatens to weaken state and local cyber capacity and vital programs like MS-ISAC. The news comes as CISA already struggles with a reported 40% vacancy rate in key mission areas, raising concerns about the nation's ability to defend against both sophisticated intrusions and common cyber threats like ransomware.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Security Operations

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: CISA budget cut, US cybersecurity policy, federal cybersecurity, CISA staffing crisis, MS-ISAC funding, Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act, national cyber defense, SLTT cybersecurity

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A shift in U.S. cyber policy to focus on state actors is clashing with a proposed 17% budget cut for CISA, threatening the agency's ability to support state and local cyber defenses.

Article Slug: us-cyber-policy-shifts-amid-cisa-budget-cuts-and-staffing-concerns

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: New 'ShinySp1d3r' RaaS Emerges from Alliance of ShinyHunters and Scattered Spider
item.description:
Headline: New 'ShinySp1d3r' RaaS Emerges from Alliance of ShinyHunters and Scattered Spider

Summary:
A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) operation named 'ShinySp1d3r' is being developed by 'SLSH,' a new cybercrime collective formed by members of the infamous ShinyHunters, Scattered Spider, and Lapsus$ groups. An early Windows build of the ransomware has been analyzed, revealing capabilities like ChaCha20 encryption, service termination, and shadow copy deletion. The group also plans to create Linux and ESXi versions, signaling an intent to target high-value enterprise environments. This development marks a significant shift, as these historically distinct extortion groups are now pooling their resources to create their own ransomware weapon.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Malware

Article Type: NewsArticle

Keywords: ShinySp1d3r ransomware, Ransomware-as-a-Service, ShinyHunters, Scattered Spider, Lapsus$, SLSH threat actor, ESXi ransomware, cybercrime collective

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A new Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) called ShinySp1d3r is being developed by a collective of notorious threat actors from ShinyHunters, Scattered Spider, and Lapsus$.

Article Slug: shinysp1d3r-raas-emerges-from-shinyhunters-and-scattered-spider-alliance

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

item.title: NEW: NVIDIA AI Toolkit and WordPress Plugins Hit with High-Severity Flaws
item.description:
Headline: NVIDIA AI Toolkit and WordPress Plugins Hit with High-Severity Flaws

Summary:
On November 25, 2025, several new software vulnerabilities were disclosed, including a high-severity Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) flaw in NVIDIA's NeMo Agent Toolkit (CVE-2025-33203) used for AI development. This flaw could lead to information disclosure and denial of service. Concurrently, vulnerabilities were found in popular WordPress plugins. The 'Just Highlight' plugin is affected by a stored Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) bug (CVE-2025-13311), while the 'Locker Content' plugin has a sensitive information exposure flaw (CVE-2025-12525) that could allow unauthenticated attackers to bypass content restrictions.

Severity: High

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cloud Security

Article Type: Advisory

Keywords: NVIDIA vulnerability, CVE-2025-33203, NeMo Agent Toolkit, WordPress plugin vulnerability, CVE-2025-13311, CVE-2025-12525, SSRF exploit, Stored XSS

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: New vulnerabilities disclosed in NVIDIA's NeMo Agent Toolkit (CVE-2025-33203) and several WordPress plugins, exposing users to Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) and Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) attacks.

Article Slug: nvidia-and-wordpress-plugins-hit-with-ssrf-and-xss-vulnerabilities

Published Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: UPDATE: Homeland Security Warns Gov't Shutdown and Lapsed Law Cripple U.S. Cyber Defenses
item.description:
Headline: Homeland Security Warns Gov't Shutdown and Lapsed Law Cripple U.S. Cyber Defenses

Summary:
The U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security has issued a stark warning in its latest 'Cyber Threat Snapshot,' stating that the nation's ability to defend against cyber threats is being severely hampered. The report cites a dual crisis: a federal government shutdown that furloughs key cybersecurity personnel, and the lapse of the Cybersecurity Information Sharing Act of 2015. This creates 'dangerous blind spots' at a time of heightened threat activity from nation-state actors like China and Iran, and a surge in attacks against U.S. critical infrastructure.

Severity: High

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Report

Meta Description: The U.S. House Committee on Homeland Security's 'Cyber Threat Snapshot' warns that a federal shutdown and lapsed information-sharing laws are weakening the nation's cyber defenses.

Article Slug: us-homeland-security-warns-of-rising-cyber-threats-amid-shutdown

Published Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 04 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Wed, 26 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Update Count: 1

Update History: 1 update recorded

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Sha1-Hulud: Destructive Supply Chain Attack Hits 25,000+ Repos via npm
item.description:
Headline: Sha1-Hulud: Destructive Supply Chain Attack Hits 25,000+ Repos via npm

Summary:
A sophisticated and self-propagating software supply chain attack, dubbed 'Sha1-Hulud,' has compromised over 25,000 GitHub repositories since November 21, 2025. The attack leverages hundreds of malicious npm packages that execute code during the `preinstall` phase to steal developer credentials, GitHub tokens, and cloud secrets. The malware exfiltrates stolen data to public GitHub repositories and includes a destructive 'scorched earth' component that wipes the victim's home directory if data theft fails, turning it into a denial-of-service attack. The campaign has impacted packages from major organizations like Zapier, Postman, and ENS Domains, highlighting a severe threat to the open-source ecosystem.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Malware, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 6 minutes

Meta Description: A massive software supply chain attack dubbed 'Sha1-Hulud' has compromised over 25,000 GitHub repositories by using malicious npm packages to steal developer credentials and secrets during the preinstall phase.

Article Slug: sha1-hulud-supply-chain-attack-compromises-25000-github-repos-via-npm

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: CISA: Commercial Spyware Hijacking Signal & WhatsApp via Zero-Clicks
item.description:
Headline: CISA: Commercial Spyware Hijacking Signal & WhatsApp via Zero-Clicks

Summary:
The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has issued a critical alert regarding active campaigns using commercial spyware to compromise the Signal and WhatsApp accounts of high-value targets. Attackers are employing sophisticated methods including social engineering, malicious QR codes for device linking, and zero-click exploits that require no user interaction. The campaigns are reportedly targeting current and former government officials, military personnel, and civil society organizations across the U.S., Europe, and the Middle East. CISA warns that initial access to messaging apps is often used as a beachhead to deploy further malware and achieve full device compromise.

Severity: High

Categories: Malware, Mobile Security, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA warns that threat actors are using commercial spyware with sophisticated techniques like zero-click exploits to hijack Signal and WhatsApp accounts of high-value targets, including government officials.

Article Slug: cisa-warns-commercial-spyware-targets-signal-whatsapp-users

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Patch Now: Critical 9.8 RCE Flaw in Oracle Identity Manager Under Active Attack
item.description:
Headline: Patch Now: Critical 9.8 RCE Flaw in Oracle Identity Manager Under Active Attack

Summary:
A critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability, CVE-2025-61757, in Oracle Identity Manager is being actively exploited by threat actors. The flaw, which has a CVSS score of 9.8, allows an unauthenticated, remote attacker to gain complete control over vulnerable systems via a specially crafted HTTP request. The vulnerability stems from a missing authentication check in the product's REST WebServices component. Due to evidence of in-the-wild exploitation, CISA has added the bug to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog and mandated that all U.S. federal agencies apply the patch by December 12, 2025.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: CISA has added a critical, actively exploited RCE vulnerability (CVE-2025-61757) in Oracle Identity Manager to its KEV catalog, ordering federal agencies to patch the 9.8 CVSS flaw by December 12, 2025.

Article Slug: cisa-orders-patch-for-critical-oracle-identity-manager-rce-flaw-cve-2025-61757

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Akira Ransomware Targets M&A Blind Spots, Breaching Firms via Inherited SonicWall Devices
item.description:
Headline: Akira Ransomware Targets M&A Blind Spots, Breaching Firms via Inherited SonicWall Devices

Summary:
The Akira ransomware group is exploiting security blind spots created during corporate mergers and acquisitions (M&A). According to research by ReliaQuest, Akira affiliates are gaining initial access to acquiring companies by compromising vulnerable SonicWall SSL VPN appliances inherited from smaller, acquired firms. Attackers leverage the fact that the acquiring organizations are often unaware of these unpatched, legacy devices on their new network. Once inside, they use zombie credentials and move laterally, with the time from lateral movement to ransomware deployment averaging less than one hour, highlighting a rapid and effective attack chain.

Severity: High

Categories: Ransomware, Threat Actor, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The Akira ransomware group is exploiting security gaps during corporate mergers and acquisitions (M&A) by compromising vulnerable SonicWall VPNs inherited from acquired firms to breach the parent company.

Article Slug: akira-ransomware-exploits-unpatched-sonicwall-devices-during-ma

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Google Patches Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day in V8 Engine
item.description:
Headline: Google Patches Actively Exploited Chrome Zero-Day in V8 Engine

Summary:
Google has released an emergency security update for its Chrome web browser to fix a high-severity zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-13223, that is being actively exploited. The flaw is a type confusion vulnerability in the V8 JavaScript engine, which could allow a remote attacker to achieve arbitrary code execution by tricking a user into visiting a malicious website. The patch has been released for Chrome version 142.0.7444.175 on Windows, macOS, and Linux. Users of other Chromium-based browsers like Microsoft Edge and Brave are also urged to update immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: Google has released an emergency patch for CVE-2025-13223, a high-severity, actively exploited zero-day type confusion vulnerability in the Chrome V8 JavaScript engine that allows for remote code execution.

Article Slug: google-patches-actively-exploited-chrome-v8-zero-day-cve-2025-13223

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Supply Chain Breach at Banking Vendor SitusAMC Exposes Client Financial Data
item.description:
Headline: Supply Chain Breach at Banking Vendor SitusAMC Exposes Client Financial Data

Summary:
SitusAMC, a major third-party technology and services provider for the banking and real estate finance industry, has disclosed a cyberattack that occurred on November 12, 2025. The attackers breached SitusAMC's systems and exfiltrated sensitive data belonging to its banking clients, including accounting records and legal agreements. Personal data of the banks' customers was also compromised. The incident, which did not involve ransomware, is being investigated with the assistance of the FBI. It serves as a stark reminder of the significant supply chain risks within the heavily regulated financial services sector.

Severity: High

Categories: Supply Chain Attack, Data Breach, Regulatory

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: SitusAMC, a major vendor for the banking industry, has suffered a supply chain cyberattack, resulting in the theft of sensitive data from its clients and their customers, highlighting major third-party risks.

Article Slug: banking-vendor-situsamc-hit-by-supply-chain-attack-client-data-stolen

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Fortinet Warns of Actively Exploited Zero-Day in FortiWeb WAF Appliances
item.description:
Headline: Fortinet Warns of Actively Exploited Zero-Day in FortiWeb WAF Appliances

Summary:
Fortinet has revealed that a command injection vulnerability in its FortiWeb web application firewall (WAF), CVE-2025-58034, was exploited as a zero-day before a patch was available. The flaw, rated medium severity (CVSS 6.7), allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary code. However, its risk is significantly elevated as it can be chained with another recently disclosed path-traversal zero-day (CVE-2025-64446). This combination allows a remote, unauthenticated attacker to bypass authentication, create an admin account, and achieve full remote code execution. Patches are available and should be applied immediately.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Cyberattack, Patch Management

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Fortinet warns of an actively exploited zero-day command injection flaw (CVE-2025-58034) in FortiWeb that can be chained with another vulnerability for unauthenticated RCE. Immediate patching is required.

Article Slug: fortinet-warns-of-actively-exploited-fortiweb-zero-day-cve-2025-58034

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Black Friday Phishing Attacks Surge Over 600%; Amazon is Top Impersonated Brand
item.description:
Headline: Black Friday Phishing Attacks Surge Over 600%; Amazon is Top Impersonated Brand

Summary:
As the Black Friday shopping season approaches, a new analysis from Darktrace reveals a massive 620% increase in phishing attacks since the beginning of November 2025. Attacks impersonating major retailers like Walmart and Macy's have jumped 54% in the last week alone. Amazon is the most abused brand, featuring in 80% of all major brand impersonation phishing attempts. Researchers warn that attack volumes are expected to climb another 20-30% during the peak shopping week, with cybercriminals using fake 'deal' websites and social engineering to lure victims into giving up personal data and payment information.

Severity: High

Categories: Phishing, Cyberattack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 4 minutes

Meta Description: A new report shows Black Friday phishing attacks have surged by 620% in November, with Amazon being impersonated in 80% of brand-related phishing scams designed to steal shopper data.

Article Slug: black-friday-phishing-attacks-skyrocket-620-percent-amazon-impersonated

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: UK Bill to Regulate Critical Infrastructure Supply Chain for First Time
item.description:
Headline: UK Bill to Regulate Critical Infrastructure Supply Chain for First Time

Summary:
The United Kingdom has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, a new law that will, for the first time, regulate the cybersecurity practices of suppliers to the nation's critical infrastructure. The bill aims to prevent supply chain attacks by legally requiring companies deemed 'critical suppliers'—such as IT management firms and data centers serving entities like the NHS and energy companies—to meet minimum security standards. These suppliers will also be mandated to report significant breaches to the government and the National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) and demonstrate robust incident response capabilities.

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Regulatory, Supply Chain Attack

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: The UK government has introduced the Cyber Security and Resilience Bill, a new law that will regulate suppliers to critical infrastructure for the first time to prevent supply chain attacks.

Article Slug: uk-introduces-cyber-security-and-resilience-bill-to-regulate-critical-suppliers

Published Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT

Created Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Updated Date: Tue, 25 Nov 2025 15:00:00 GMT

Read Full Article →

item.title: NEW: Flaw in Chinese Electric Buses Allowing Remote Disabling Sparks European Security Probes
item.description:
Headline: Flaw in Chinese Electric Buses Allowing Remote Disabling Sparks European Security Probes

Summary:
A software vulnerability discovered in Chinese-made electric buses operating in Oslo, Norway, has raised significant security alarms across Europe. The flaw could reportedly allow the vehicles to be remotely disabled, prompting authorities in the UK and Denmark to launch their own investigations into similar bus fleets. This incident has intensified concerns about potential backdoors and kill switches in Chinese technology embedded in critical public infrastructure. The finding comes amid heightened warnings from security agencies about pre-positioned threats in Western networks, such as the 'Volt Typhoon' campaign.

Severity: High

Categories: Industrial Control Systems, Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

Article Type: NewsArticle

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: A software vulnerability in Chinese-made electric buses that could allow for remote disabling has been found in Norway, prompting security investigations in the UK and Denmark amid fears of backdoors in critical infrastructure.

Article Slug: remote-disabling-flaw-in-chinese-electric-buses-sparks-european-security-probes

item.title: UPDATE: URGENT: CISA Orders 7-Day Patch for Actively Exploited FortiWeb Zero-Day
item.description:
Headline: URGENT: CISA Orders 7-Day Patch for Actively Exploited FortiWeb Zero-Day

Summary:
Fortinet has disclosed a critical OS command injection zero-day vulnerability, CVE-2025-58034, in its FortiWeb Web Application Firewall (WAF) that is being actively exploited in the wild. The flaw allows an authenticated attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the underlying system. In response to observed attacks, the U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) has added the vulnerability to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog and issued an emergency directive mandating federal agencies apply patches within an accelerated seven-day window, by November 25, 2025. Researchers have detected approximately 2,000 attacks leveraging the flaw and warn it could potentially be chained with a recently disclosed authentication bypass vulnerability (CVE-2025-64446) to achieve unauthenticated remote code execution.

Severity: Critical

Categories: Vulnerability, Patch Management, Cyberattack

Article Type: Advisory

Reading Time: 5 minutes

Meta Description: Fortinet discloses and CISA mandates urgent patching for CVE-2025-58034, a critical OS command injection zero-day in FortiWeb WAFs that is under active exploitation. Learn about the risks and mitigation steps.

Article Slug: cisa-mandates-7-day-patch-for-actively-exploited-fortinet-fortiweb-zero-day-cve-2025-58034

Published Date: Thu, 20 Nov 2025 00:00:00 GMT
